lexUnit.name: mask.n

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for all or part of the face, worn as a disguise, for protection or hygiene, or for theatrical effect.

sentence.text: We splashed and laughed and played together for a long time , sharing their delight at looking underwater through a diving mask for the first time .
Theresa 's had to get a gas mask for little James but she ca n't imagine how she 'd ever put it on the poor child .
I knew initially I did n't want a man in a silver suit with a mask over his head -- the sort of thing you see in fairgrounds .
The Sheikha covered her mask with her veils .
She offered the boy a grizzly bear mask with fur fabric ears .
I 've had him put in a strait-jacket and one of those leather masks with the little bars over the mouth hole .
We stopped in Thimi , a village obscurely famous for a type of papier mache mask .
He hammered again , pulling off his mask , and shouting .
The door burst open and two men came in wearing stocking masks .
Soon after the ceremony he went to Glasgow , where he fell ill with what would seem to have been smallpox , and from vanity kept a taffeta mask over his face .
Then he took off his mask , and I saw his face . "
She had them put an oxygen mask over Matthew 's face immediately .
CLAIRE , as pale as the winter daybreak she will never see again , sits on her bed wheezing through the oxygen mask she has worn for the past three months .
Then her mask slips off and she jumps back .
In 1984 , East Germany ( GDR ) supplied Iran with 5,000 `` respirators , '' which turned out to be industrial half - masks with goggles , which are unsuitable for chemical defense .
